experience: You and Lauren A. both know Anila Arthanari, Keith Rezendes, and 43 others

Today is my last day at Stepstone before starting a new role at Google as a UX Researcher. It's been an amazing few months here working with some brilliant systems and incredibly talented people but I can't wait to see what Google has in store!!

You should NEVER take a job offer purely for more money (in most cases) Happiness in other areas is just as important, money is purely a bonus and will come with the more value you add to the market place.
Finding a company which matches your deep core values is important. Values are your own private beliefs about what is most important to you.

In order to truly change, grow and prosper in our careers, we need to become consciously aware of the rules we have for ourselves and others, of how we really measure or judge success or failure. Otherwise we could be in the highest paying job possible and still feel like nothing. This is the power values hold in a job seeking process!

I see it all the time, a person goes to a high paying job but doesn't enjoy it, it doesn't give them the warm feeling. What they have really done is violated their belief about what is right and wrong, resulting in inner turmoil.
Money will come, all about balance in a job.
Good luck to everyone who has been searching for a job this week :-)

As part of  72U, a creative residency designed to open people up to new ways of thinking, collaborating, and tackling modern communication problems, I worked with a multi-disciplinary team to design and prototype new interactive media for brands to connect with consumers.

As a user experience designer at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory, I gained hands on experience understanding human needs and behavior on a range of long-term research projects and short-term web applications. With a collaborative team of designers and developers, I helped strategize, visualize and implement thoughtful and efficient user interfaces driven by user feedback and user needs.

Studying under a tight-knit team of experienced and talented designers, I prototyped web interfaces for clients and created visual content and copy for USER10's website to showcase their client portfolio work.

I led collaborative decision-making, planning, and accountability with the board of directors and provided guidance around recruitment, marketing, and execution of the organization.• Led the creation of recruiting plans for all delegate positions for organization.• Explained all of the policies, procedures, laws, standards and regulations to each member of the organization.• Developed a crowdsourcing campaign raising over $20,000 to provide students with scholarships• Created and managed website collegetownasu.com
Social Impact Hub for Student Entrepreneurs

With a group of passionate change agents and student leaders, I managed a resource hub to provide student entrepreneurs with resources and opportunities to inspire, catalyze, and sustain student-driven social change. My involvement allowed me to speak at Ignite@ASU and attend Clinton Global Initiatives University and the Ashoka Social Entrepreneurship in Higher Education Conference. • Interacted in a professional manner with students, parents, departments, and other community entities or individuals in need of information and resources. • Answered inquiries regarding community service, service learning, national service, entrepreneurship and high impact careers both in-person and on the phone
Taught the scientific method and presented engaging science lessons to 2nd-5th graders at local elementary schools (eg. lava lamps, mentos/coke, ice cream!)

The Cooper method to interaction design emphasizes research upfront in order to maximize the chance of a useful final design. It seeks clarity along the way through the crafting of goal-oriented statements, scenarios, and functions.In this 3-day course, we applied research-driven methods to identify and define a problem, crafted no-fluff personas based on user goals, and mapped out clear scenarios and storyboards which supported our framework (wireframe) solutions.

Built a fully responsive, interactive website in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and gained skills/ understanding in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, GitHub, and Sublime.

recommendations: Cindy Yan
Manager, SEO & Analytics at Leaf Group
June 24, 2017, Cindy and Lauren A. were students together

Lauren is one of the most passionate and dedicated people I know. Every project she takes on is infused with heart and soul. We met at the Front End Web Development class at General Assembly. I was inspired by her desire to learn and apply her learning to her work. She worked on various side projects which were later recognized by her team at JPL. She is a strong addition to any team she joins.

Mike Alonzo
I make the complex simple.
November 29, 2016, Mike was Lauren A.’s mentor

Lauren was great. She demonstrated a passionate and proactive nature, jumping into any project headfirst. It was my intention to push Lauren out of her comfort zone by giving her tasks with little guidance, and without fail, Lauren continued to rise to the occasion. She always owned her role and took great pride in executing with purpose.
